snippet: A report says that some lack basic resources and don’t meet certain state standards, despite a 2006 court ruling requiring New York State to increase spending on public education.
abstract: Researchers affiliated with Teachers College at Columbia University report that many schools in poor districts of New York State, including three in New York City, lack basic resources, and some do not even meet minimum state standards in certain areas, despite 2006 landmark court ruling requiring state to increase spending in public education.
lead_paragraph: A report says that some lack basic resources and don’t meet certain state standards, despite a 2006 court ruling requiring New York State to increase spending on public education.

headline.seo: Years After Ruling, Poor Schools in New York Still Struggle
headline.main: Poor Schools Struggling to Meet State Standards, Years After Critical Ruling
headline.print_headline: Poor Schools Struggling To Meet State Standards, Years After Critical Ruling
